sen.j: 正広（しょうこう、1412年 - 1493年?）は、室町時代中期の僧・歌人。
sen.e: Shoko (1412-1493) was a priest and waka poet in the middle of the Muromachi period.
Shoko (1412-1493) was a priest and waka poet in the middle of the Muromachi period.
Shoko (1412 - 1493?) was a priest and waka poet in the middle of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。?補足しました。

sen.e: His Buddhist name was Shogetsuan.
His Buddhist name was Shogetsuan.
His go (pen name) was Shogetsuan.

sen.j: 法号ははじめ正晄・正晃と称した。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) had been 正晄 or 正晃 at first.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) had been 正晄 or 正晃 at first.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) had been Shoko (written in Chinese character as 正晄 or 正晃) at first.
sen.cmt: Shoko (written in Chinese character as ～)補足しました。

sen.j: 日比（ひごろ）の正広とも称された。
sen.e: He was also called Higoro-no-Shoko.
He was also called Higoro-no-Shoko.
He was also called Higoro no Shoko.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 没年については1494年ともされる。
sen.e: It is also said that he was dead in 1494.
It is also said that he was dead in 1494.
It is also said that he was dead in 1494.

sen.j: 初め飛鳥井家のもとで歌道を学んだが、その後東福寺の清巌正徹の有心歌風に傾倒してその門弟になり、1459年（長禄3年）正徹がなくなると、招月庵を継いだ。
sen.e: He learned the art of tanka poetry under the family of Asukai, then became to admire Shotetsu Seigan's poetic style of Yushin to become his desciple, and succeeded his name of Shogetsuan after his death.

He learned the art of tanka poetry under the family of Asukai, then became to admire Shotetsu Seigan's poetic style of Yushin to become his desciple, and succeeded his name of Shogetsuan after his death.

He learned the art of waka poetry under the family of Asukai, then became to admire Seigan Shotetsu's poetic style of ushin (sentiment with artistic sensibility) to become his disciple, and succeeded his name of Shogetsuan after his death.
sen.cmt: tankaをwakaに訂正しました。discipleスペル訂正しました。Seigan Shotetsuと訂正しました。有心→ushin (sentiment with artistic sensibility)と訂正しました。

sen.j: 応仁の乱（1466年－1476年）では難を避けるため京都を離れた。
sen.e: During the Onin war he left Kyoto to take refuge.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Onin war he left Kyoto to take refuge.
During the Onin War (1466 - 1476) he left Kyoto to take refuge.
sen.cmt: War大文字にしました。(1466 - 1476)補足しました。

sen.j: 師正徹の歌集である「草根集」の編纂や歌会の指導を行ったりしている。
sen.e: He edited Sokonshu which was his teacher, Shotetsu's poetry collection, and leaded Uta-kai (poem competition).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He edited Sokonshu which was his teacher, Shotetsu's poetry collection, and leaded Uta-kai (poem competition).
He edited 'Sokonshu' which was his teacher, Shotetsu's poetry collection, and leaded Uta-kai (poem competition).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて' 'を補足しました。

sen.j: 家集『松下集』があり、他に『正広詠歌』や文明 (日本)5年(1473年)に駿河国に下った際の紀行文である『正広日記』等もある。
sen.e: His personal collections of poetry were, "Shokashu", "Shoko Eika", and "Diary of Shoko" which was his travel journal to Suruga Province in 1473.
sen.cmt: 原文のままでは主語がありませんでしたので、「彼の家集には･･･があり」（「His persona lcollections of poetry were」）としました。（記載されている歌集は全てpersonal collectionと思われるので。）
sen.e: His personal collections of poetry were, "Shokashu", "Shoko Eika", and "Diary of Shoko" which was his travel journal to Suruga Province in 1473.
His personal collections of poetry were, "Shokashu," "Shoko Eika," and "Shoko-Ki" (the diary of Shoko) which was his travel journal to Suruga Province in 1473.
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。"Shoko-Ki" (the diary of Shoko)と訂正しました。
